result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Koepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas S Koepp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas S Koepp was found guilty of Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas S Koepp
